Reviews.Title: “Very good - am surprised while reading the negative reviews of others”
Reviews.Author: Lilit M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in August 2009 while travelling in Italy with my 12 yo daughter. Was satisfied with everything - very clean rooms, clean and new bathrooms, nice and polite employees, good breakfast, GREAT location just next to the Republic square and Taormina station. Very close to the main shopping streets ...In case i visit Rome again, i'll be happy to stay at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: Nathan_80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated as much as 10 minutes walking distance from the termini c.station. The rooms are small but i think it is considered a standard size room for this money in Rome. We arrived for a vacation with my father. we had booking for 4 nights. At the beginning it all seemed quite decent, though the receptionists (each one of them) couldn't even broke down a simple sentence in English, Although late afternoon on the first day the air condition broke down. While reporting this to the reception, the first reaction was a denial which was followed by a promise that it will be fixed by "bed time". "Bed time" arrived and the air condition was still not operating. The receptionist offered us a different room, and while escorting us he "realized" that's it is actually a general problem of the whole hotel. The stuff kept lying to our face threw all the first two days on which we decided to leave. That was probably the worst costumer service experience i have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great and cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: Resell01
Reviews.Content: All in all a great little hotel, situated in the very centre of Rome. Not far from the Central Station, not far from anything, in fact. Room was very nice and the size was good. Breakfast was as can be expected. Only thing that could have been better, was the fact that the airconditioning didn´t work and we stayed there in the middle of a heat wave.

Reviews.Title: “A tourist-class hotel with all the no-frills amenities”
Reviews.Author: kaputnik
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently during winter in Rome. It was quite a walk (with luggage) from the Rome Termini, about 700m although the hotel is nicely located among shops, supermarkets, cafes and even a flea market (during mornings) outside its doorstep. My friends and I were given a triple room on the first floor and the windows managed to block out most of the street noise. Despite my fears in reading the reviews, I found the stay quite pleasant. The staff could speak basic English and were quite helpful ( esp during a unprecedented bathroom flooding incident) in answering queries, acceding to requests and carrying luggage down the steps. The room was alright in size, considering there were three beds, with a safe, working fridge and air-conditioner/heater. My only gripe was that the TV was not working during my 3-night stay there due to some decoder problems. Breakfast was sparse - cold hard bread, meats, cheese, spreads and a coffee machine. Tables were clean and promptly cleared by the helpful chambermaid so no problems there. In all, not too bad for a relatively budgeted tourist-class hotel with no-frills.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Joolsie66
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with this hotel. We booked and paid over 6 months in advance and when we arrived they gave us the worst room right near the foyer. We were kept awake all night by noisy guests and the breakfast was practically non-existent. We complained and asked for another room and they declined our request. Other guests made the same complaints. The room was not clean either. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Poor poor poor*dont go there*staff doesnt speak english!!!!”
Reviews.Author: frank358fr
Reviews.Content: I was stuck with this hotel for eight nights and would not recommend it. My girlfiriend and I expected a normal room, and did get it. The room was very small, smell like [--]. A broken fridge in the room, a TV that's remote controls did not work. The staff at the desk were not helpful and did not care. The breakfast consisted of a roll and a coffee machine. The 'restaurant and bar' area were only open for breakfast. Moreover, our A/C doesnt work for 2 days, and the temperature outside was 40C. It was very hot in the room and we cant even sleep at night because it was to hot in the room. The staff doesnt speak english well. He said like 2 words in english and the rest of the sentence in italia!! WTF.. I dont speak italian!! Anyway... DO NOT GO IN THIS HOTEL!! Beware!!

Reviews.Title: “Ruined the stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rinasmith2
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay 6 nights, but stayed only 4. List of problems: we were travelling in 6 (3 men, 3 women, not married to each other) we booked 3 rooms with double occupancy. The girls decided to all stay in one room, leaving one of the men on their own. We told the hotel up front we were doing this and initially they had no problem. 2 days later the hotel wanted to charge the man in the single room and extra charge of 30 euros per night for his single occupancy. The clerk that asked us for the money claimed that her manager told her to ask. We asked to speak to that manager and the manager REFUSED to speak with us. We checked out early. We felt harassed and that the hotel was trying to rip us off. Other items to note: buffet breakfast did not have a good selection - lunch meat, bread, crostata, nutella, pre-packaged dry toast. Other hotel we stayed in at least offered cereal and yogurt. There was no shower curtain and rooms small.
